channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2023070912
item.description:
Report X-2023070912

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet at Orlando Local terminal and moved to the hub for reports. DescribePack: The cap was loose on 1 jug of Rapicide PA Part B, causing contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070759
item.description:
Report X-2023070759

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. received off trailer# 556590, damaged; wet. Pkg. taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection contents, it was noted that one of the caps was cracked, causing liquid to leak out. There were no items in pkg. to protect the contents. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. placed inside bin in HWPA awaiting disposition from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023070749
item.description:
Report X-2023070749

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. brought back to station due to leakage, coded 10 by driver. Pkg. taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting pkg. it was noted that both cans were leaking, loose caps. Cans were placed in a tight box with no partition or coverage for caps, cans placed in plastic bag. Orientation arrows on box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting HWPA awaiting disposition from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023070737
item.description:
Report X-2023070737

  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: The crimped on lid on the 5-gallon metal pail in the box came loose, causing contents to leak out. There was no physical damage to the metal pail, except for the loose lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070681
item.description:
Report X-2023070681

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver brought back leaking package DescribePack: 2 32fl oz bottles of NuCalgon Drain Solve in box with packing paper. Lid came off 1 bottle and spilled all liquid into the box and into the delivery truck. Box only marked with directional arrows, no LQ diamonds. Possible that the heat caused the liquid to expand and pop cap off as this is the 3rd package of this material that has been found damaged in 2 days. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver placed package inside a plastic bag and gave to QA when he returned to the station

item.title: Report X-2023060851
item.description:
Report X-2023060851

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found during the off load at our Fort Lauderdale ramp location. Upon opening a loading container, a single package was found emitting a strong odor. Further investigation found that there appeared to staining indicating a leak within the package. Package was a UN 3363 packed in a fiberboard box and it is reported the piece was placed in a plastic moisture barrier and was surrounded by pigmats and large green bubble wrap. it was not seen from where on the apparatus the leak was originating. Package was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper to be contacted to retrieve package.

The leaking jerrican was placed into a hazmat container and transported to the processing area. DescribePack: Not visibly seen but contents leaking from the bottom indicates a crack or puncture. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaking jerrican was immediatly placed into a hazmat container and transported to hazmat processing area within QA cage.

item.title: Report E-2023070531
item.description:
Report E-2023070531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: MILTON
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 29, 2023, one (1) 50-pound bag of potassium hydroxide was damaged by a skid and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surface. E3 personnel deployed absorbent pads and hand tools to the potassium hydroxide-impacted roadway. All spent absorbent pads were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail for terminal disposal. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.
